Reviews.Title: “Overall Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: seekingservice
Reviews.Content: Pros: Friendly & cooperative staff, large room, 'green' program, great shower experience, location, wifi, cold refrigerator and housekeeping. The staff was courteous, the room was spacious, the shower was great and the housekeeper that cleaned our room did a very good job. Cons: Hotel allows semi trucks to park sideways thus taking up 8 spots each. With 2 trucks one night, we had to park precariously behind one of them. No vehicle damage thank goodness. Chair and mini ottoman are dated/worn. Beds appear older and did not provide the most comfortable night's rest. Breakfast was plain so we never ate at hotel. This advertised 3 star hotel was booked via Priceline and we got a very good value for the money. We would stay here again due to location, staff, cleanliness, green program and shower.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy here”
Reviews.Author: hsipes
Reviews.Content: This is an older Holiday Inn. The rooms were outdated, but clean. We used the pool and hot tub which gave our family of 4 a chemical burn. I called the front desk to let them know to check the chemical levels. The clerk was very nice and apologetic, even offered us a free movie. I told her that I didn't want anything except to make sure that the levels were correct. We had 2 beds in our room. One was very lumpy, put the kids on it, the other was OK. Not like the new beds in the newer hotels. There is another HOliday Inn Express Suites very close by. Search under Holiday Inn Express Suites Indianapolis Southeast. MUCH nicer hotel, large rooms, modern. Same price booked direct through their website. I was confused when I booked this one, as I thought we were staying at the other one. Woops. Boy was I disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Adam M
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel. Stayed at a few and this is very nice. Clean airy rooms (very similar to their 'standard' rooms. We didn't use the gym, pool or breakfast area - were only here for an overnight stay and had an early check out. Rooms were clean and tidy - staff were helpful. Very good :) Only issue was the room cleaners. They knocked on the door 4 times in the morning starting at about 9:00 till 10:00. Was very annoying especially as it was about every 25 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT EXCELLENT EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: NYDrummer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Holiday Inn Express during Super Bowl weekend and the place was great. The hotel attended to every last detail, from welcome amenities in the room that included football cookies, a "Welcome to Indiana" candy bar, and a pamphlet with maps, shopping, restaurants, and all the Super Bowl parties. The hotel is clean, the rooms are nice sized, the staff is extremely friendly and accommodating, and the location is great. 10 minutes straight north on US 31 to downtown Indy, and 5 minutes south to any chain restaurant you could want (Cheesecake Factory, Chili's, Ruby Tuesday's, Hooters, City Barbecue, etc.), as well as a Simon mall. There is also a CVS right on the corner and the location is a few hundred yards south of the highway. I actually had a prepaid reservation at a similar category hotel by the airport, but the place was dirty, noisy, and totally unacceptable to the point where I couldn't stay there. All the downtown hotels were sold out (naturally) - Luckily I checked on TripAdvisor and found this HIE - when I called I was totally surprised that they had a room available. Myra at the front desk was extremely helpful - she described the hotel in detail and gave me a very fair rate considering the demand for the weekend. Once I arrived I knew it was the best decision I made the whole weekend, and it greatly contributed to the incredible time we had. I would definitely stay here again on future trips to Indy and would definitely recommend this property to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Did not stay”
Reviews.Author: ohiograndma
Reviews.Content: I tryed to book a room, but when I called the hotel they were very rude and told me they only had king rooms for one hundred and fifty dollars. I was going to take one and asked if they had a hotel suttle and was told no. I asked if there was a cab service and the girl at the desk said she didn't know and Hung up on me. Hey Holiday inn, take a lesson from Country inn, treat your guest with respect, and get your prices in line. You are not too big to fail. I am also a priorty club member, and bing treated like that.

Reviews.Title: “A nice and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: OhioRon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located just south of I-465 on US-31. The hotel interior is quite attractive, and check-in was quick. Our room was large, with two full-sized beds, an upholstered chair, a desk with nice chair, a small microwave, and a fairly large refrigerator (larger than dorm size but smaller than full size). My wife appreciated the full-length mirror in the room. The flat screen TV appeared to be about 40 inches. They offer free WiFi in the room, but you need to get a username and password from the front desk. The bed was perfect--neither too soft nor too firm. They provided both firm and soft pillows to choose from. The bathroom has a long counter with a single sink. The tub/shower area was clean and inviting. There was a bit of a problem with the shower--when you try to have the water come out of the shower, most of it still comes out at the bottom (to the tub) and the shower stream isn't strong. We reported that problem the next morning, and it was fixed within 30 minutes. The breakfast selections included scrambled eggs (instant, I think), sausage patties, some nice warm cinnamon rolls, biscuits with sausage gravy, and a number of cold selections (rolls, bread, fruit). There was a machine that apparently could be used to make pancakes, but we didn't try that. There were several sections for coffee and tea, as well as three juices (orange, apple, and one I can't recall). Pretty nice overall. There is a fairly large pool and a fitness room (but we didn't visit the latter). The public areas and the room were all clean and well maintained and the people who work here are quite friendly. We come to this area once or twice each year, and I'm sure we will stay here again. We enjoyed our visit to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place for business travel”
Reviews.Author: WNY_Voyager
Reviews.Content: It was a good place, big room, cheep, good clean bed and the internet connection was perfect. Not too many places to eat around here but if you keep driving south you'll find some nice places. Overall average HI express.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Breid5
Reviews.Content: This hotel was easy to get to from the airport. It was clean and quiet, but nothing fancy. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “MORE EMPHASIS NEEDS TO BE PUT ON THE DOUBLE KING BEDS!”
Reviews.Author: Gene F
Reviews.Content: The Hotel claims that this is the only hotel in the world that has 2 king beds in every room along with a 42" flat screen in every room. I have stayed in hundreds of hotels around the world anf have never seen this. This is a huge plus!!!!!!!!! Especially for a family of 4. There should be more emphasis on this.

Reviews.Title: “We did not have a good experience”
Reviews.Author: ricopolatzo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is listed as 2 1/2 stars so I was not expecting to stay at the Ritz, but room was far from being acceptable. If I had planned to stay at this hotel longer than one night I would have found other accommodations. The room was fairly clean. The room had a musty smell and the beds were very uncomfortable. In fact, it was the worst night sleep that I have ever had in a hotel. The staff was not friendly and they were not rude........they were just there. The breakfast in the morning was a nice touch and the food was pretty good. I could not in good faith recommend this hotel to anyone and this one experience may keep me from staying at a Holiday Inn Express again. I stayed at this very same hotel a few years ago and my experience was fine. All I can say is that the next time we visit Indianapolis we will spring for a more upscale hotel. This was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not motorcycle friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Tim E
Reviews.Content: This hotel chain is usually very good and this one is basically ok. But the manager would not let me park my motorcycle under a very large covered area during a heavy rainstorm. There was plenty of room and the bike wouldnt have blocked anything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent with a great Free Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Guest1957
Reviews.Content: This was a pleasant surprise!!! Room was very clean and bed VERY comfortable. 15 minutes from Downtown but Indy pretty easy town to get around in. Staff very nice with wonderful breakfast hostess.

Reviews.Title: “Bit problems, but mostly well handled.”
Reviews.Author: improbability32
Reviews.Content: First off, it's obvious this hotel is old. The entire place smells a little musty, the pool area is a little dirty in those ways that you can't really clean easily, and the exercise room smells very weird. The carpet in the huge, nicely decorated lobby is stained pretty badly. But you can tell the daily cleaning maids do a fantastic job. They just need to update and replace quite a few things. Our specific problem: we were in Indy for a con, and the people in charge stupidly waited until the day before to book a room. So we got a two double bed handicap room, which they admit, they never use. Well, you can tell. Dust accumulation in not obvious places, the shower curtain was just gone from the very oddly designed bathroom. I've stayed in a handicap room before, this one was weird. And slippery when showering, cause that makes total sense. But the kicker was the AC unit. It was leaking all over the floor, probably had been for a while. The room smelled moldy, the air itself was damp. We complained and they said they'd send maintenance in the morning. So we spent a night in that room and all woke up with funny feeling throats. Later that day when we asked is when they admitted no one uses that room, that they'd probably have to rip out the carpet and replace the AC unit completely. So they moved us next door, which was much nicer, but still a little.... eh. I'm just thankful they had a room for us. They had sold out the first night, which is why we got stuck in the bad room for the night. Two big pros for this hotels: 1) The breakfast is huge for a hotel's and awesome. 2) The shower is to die for. Just, you know, not the one in the handicap room, cause then I'd mean that literally. We're going back to Indy in a week for business and are choosing to stay at a Hampton a little bit away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price..just pick the right bed.”
Reviews.Author: psupiller
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great bargain....excellent price, clean, good housekeeping, good location, fairly close to several restaurants and a drugstore. My only complaint would be the double beds. As far as I could tell, the only beds available were doubles or kings, and the double is barely adequate for two average sized adults. The bed itself was comfortable and clean, but a queen sized bed would be a lot better. All in all, a nice place that I would stay at again....in a room with a king sized bed.

Reviews.Title: “Worse Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CSM0005
Reviews.Content: Ok, so check in time is at 3:00 pm & I get in the hotel at 3:30 & had an appointment at 4:00. Was told the room wasn't ready & there was a guy after me & they told him the same thing. I asked what the hold up was since there were only a few cars in the lot on a Sunday afternoon. The rude front desk person (short girl dark hair) said they are behind in cleaning rooms. Then when I mentioned my appt. & wanted to get things in my room, she said it will be another 30 minutes at least but she can put me in another room. Thought it may be an upgrade, not...it was a downgrade. Later that night my friend & I looked forward to the hot tub, went in & the water wasn't warm (the pool was warmer). We told the front desk which the maintenance guy looked & said he re-set the heater & give it about 20 minutes. After 30 minutes went to front & maintenance was talking to front desk clerk & asked him. He came in to look & said they'll have to call out to have it fixed. He asked if he can talk them into getting us a jacuzzi suite if that would be ok, said sure. Came back & told me that the manager said no because we only had 2 hours left (which technically was 4) & they wouldn't do it (good customer service...NOT!) So we went back to room to watch tv, what an outdated tv & the channels didn't even come in & were all static. The next morning I asked for a refund to Hotwire & the new front desk clerk (blonde & also very rude) said they can't refund which I know for a fact is not true they just won't do it. Then asked for the manager & he said the hot tub is not listed as an amenity so if it's not working it's not their fault. Whatever, he said they'll call to get it looked at, I said hopefully today because I'd like to go in it later. I immediately called Hotwire for them to note this & Hotwire called the manager & somehow he already called for service within the 2 minutes since I talked to him...liar! The hot tub was working later that night but isn't relaxing at all, the air holes are at head level & so loud, sounds like you've got your ear next to a loud car exhaust. Then as we got out & dried off noticed the bubbles...GROSS, black dirt all on top of the bubbles. When being in the hot tub noticed black around the tile & rubbed it to see if it was stained but nope, smeared so it was dirt. I do not recommend this hotel at all, for a few $'s more it's worth it to go to a 3 star hotel...big difference!

Reviews.Title: “Would not return!”
Reviews.Author: tylerintr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in serious need of an upgrade! We stayed with another couple and our children. The beds were seriously uncomfortable. The pool was so/so and the hot tub was beyond disgusting! There was a layer of dirt floating on top of the foam on top of the water. Then there was a woman picking lice out of her kids hair and throwing them into the pool.......I know that the hotel has no control of that but come on! NASTY!! Needless to say it was one of the worst stays in a hotel we have ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty!!!! and out dated”
Reviews.Author: smartguy31
Reviews.Content: A co-worker and I stayed at this location on december 7th for one night.Upon arriving at 7:00 pm my co-worker checked into his room first and once in room found that room was not cleaned from previous guest. The staff did upgrade him to a suite but it was not all that clean either. As i entered my room I wanted to take a shower after a long drive...went to get in and my tub looked like someone had shaved in it...hair everywhere and also all around bathroom....the heating unit in room did not work right and was very loud...louder than anyone i have ever heard before....I would suggest staying at the HIE a couple miles away (holiday inn express southeast indianapolis)

Reviews.Title: “Should meet your needs...”
Reviews.Author: OKTraveler77
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything a business traveler could want: free, decent breakfast; workout facility (although pretty small); indoor swimming pool; mini frig and microwave in the room; and wifi. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful. The location is right by a highway, but it's difficult to get in to the hotel parking lot itself. You have to make a u-turn, but traffic usually isn't too heavy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Button_8
Reviews.Content: Was overall a good hotel, nothing fancy. THE BEDS WERE HARD, not the pillow top kind. I'm actually getting weary of Holiday Inn Express Hotels. Never know when one is going to be good or bad, their are too many hit and misses with that chain.

Reviews.Title: “I would be back in a second!”
Reviews.Author: Vully
Reviews.Content: It was my first time staying in a Holiday Inn Express and I was impressed. The staff, breakfast and pool were all excellent. The breakfast was more like a mini-buffet. The rooms were nice, clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would/will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: WakeyEngland
Reviews.Content: We were on a road trip and had booked this hotel through Priceline. There is nothing wrong with this establishment and we would recommend it if you are travelling around. The room was large and clean and was like a self contained studio with micro wave, fridge and television. The staff were polite and were helpful in giving directions to the nearest post office. We found that most mid west hotels offered a complimentary breakfast as this one did. The hotel is located about 3 miles from the city centre and around 2 miles from the airport. It has a number of fast food chain restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: roadtripper10
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a couple of time when coming to University of Indianapolis. This hotel has a very reasonable U INdy rate. Rooms are clean, lobby is very nice, breakfast is clean and fair variety of selectoins, but nothing fancy. Pool is small but good for kids, hot tub was fine too. Staff was very nice throughout the three day stay. Check in and check out were quick. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Jessicashaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn through the Family Fun package with the Indianapolis Zoo and Children's Museum. The room was great. The bedding is new and updated, not the usual (never washed) blankets. We were able to get in our room when we arrived at 11 am, not the normal 3pm check in time. The only part of the hotel that could use some improvement was the swimming pool. The sides and the bottom were in need of some cleaning! Overall, we were very pleased with our experience.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE / GOOD STAFF-TRAVEL AGENT PERSPECTIVE”
Reviews.Author: angiulida
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a group of about 50. It was very sufficient for the groups needs. Nothing fancy, but clean and cute. The rooms were good size, and the free breakfast came in handy because we were in a rush every morning when we had to leave for a youth convention. The day staff was amazing, especially Heather and company, and the manager. The night staff had one women who was a little grouchy and all the teens were afraid of her! OF course, with 40 kids walking around the lobby until 100 or 200am every night wouldnt put me in the greatest mood either! The front desk day staff Heather and I beleive the guys name was David, were exstremely friendly and helpful. They helped us with everything from directions, to recommendations, to getting me dish soap for my room! The lobby area was very cute with tables and chairs to eat breakfast or play cards at night. The pool was nice, too bad no outdoor pool, but there were some lounge chairs outside to sit on. This hotel was only 10 minutes to the convention center, and I liked the fact we shared a parking lot with CVS, which came in handy. There was lots of restraunts around too, chinese, wendys, taco bell,Mcdonalds, Dennys, and few fancy ones. A good choice if you are on a budget but CLEAN AND CUTE is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed...”
Reviews.Author: travel03
Reviews.Content: I booked this Holiday Inn Express not expecting much, but was pleasantly suprised. The room was very nice, very clean, stylish updated furniture & bed linens, better than it shows in the photos on this site. The bathroom was nicer than some 4 or 5 star hotels. The bathroom had a marble counter, shower head with adjustable water pressure, curved shower bar for more spacious showering & updated stylish decor, too. My only complaint with the room is that the air/ heat vent would periodically become VERY noisy and woke me up once during the night. However, I never made a complaint with the hotel so I can't say anything bad. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to any traveler. I work in the travel industry, myself and will recommend this location to my clients, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay - well recommended”
Reviews.Author: aqua_girl68
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the HIE South the weekend of June 30th when we came to watch the Formula One races. Although the hotel was a bit farther away from the track than he expected, the hotel stay itself was very enjoyable. I had to fly in early on Friday because of a problem with flights and had to try to work remotely. I arrived at the hotel around 11am (they picked me up in a complimentary shuttle from the airport which only took about 20 mins after I called.) and although my room was not ready (Check in is at 3pm) the desk manager graciously invited me to hang out in the lobby, connect through their free wireless and watch the World Cup soccer game which was on. I was very comfortable sitting at one of their tables, got to take care of my work responsibilities and got to watch (sort of) the World Cup game. Their wireless is free of charge and very reliable. The room was clean, airconditioning worked well and overall I was very happy. There is also a CVS pharmacy, a Dennys and a Red Lobster all within walking distance! Overall, the staff and housekeeping made my stay very enjoyable and I would have no problem recommending this Holiday Inn to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: LaMarianina
Reviews.Content: Very nice property in a good location. Friendly service. Great rooms. Plentiful breakfast. Nice fitness and pool area. Only complaint- advertised free internet access is wireless not DSL.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everything I needed. The service was excellent and the attention of everyone working there the best! The breakfast very good. The location great I was really happy and I hope to come back again.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Indianapolis South
HotelInfo.Address: 5151 S East Street, Indianapolis, IN 46227
